page.title: 01Introduction page
page.content: The area under study has a grid reference of{03120531,}it lies to the north of{Cockermouth,}a small market town on the northern edge of the Lake district and includes a small area of the town itself.Apart from this and the villages of{Bridekirk}and{Redmain} the area is mainly agricultural. The agriculture is mainly grassland, extensive and intensive with some arable and root crops. Also there is an area of forest called the{Setmurphy {plantation. { }There are two main roads in the area the A595 and the old A66. The River Derwent also runs throught the square from NE to SW. The urban land-uses of Cockermouth included in the area are; a school, a housing estate, a cottage hospital and a caravan park.
